item.title: Claude Code - Tools and Permissions
item.description:
In the previous chapter, we learned how to manage context effectively by adding files, images, and using commands like /clear and /compact. Now let’s explore the built-in tools Claude Code uses to perform actions and how to manage permissions for those tools.

How Claude Code Uses Tools

When you ask Claude Code to do something, it automatically selects the appropriate built-in tool:

  • Read - View file contents
  • Edit - Modify existing files
  • Write - Create new files
  • Bash - Execute shell commands
  • Glob - Find files by pattern
  • Grep - Search file contents
  • Task - Launch specialized agents
  • TodoWrite - Create task checklists

You don’t need to specify which tool to useâ€”Claude Code determines this based on your instructions.

item.title: Automating Manjaro Setup with Ansible
item.description:
Overview

Setting up a fresh Linux installation can be a time-consuming and repetitive process. Every time you install Manjaro (or any Linux distribution), you face the same tedious tasks: installing your favorite applications, configuring your development environment, setting up tools, and tweaking system settings to match your preferences.

Enter Manjaro Playbook - an Ansible-based automation framework that transforms this multi-hour ordeal into a single command execution. This project represents the “infrastructure as code” philosophy applied to personal workstation configuration.
